intro: Verbascum × araratense, commonly known as the Armenian mullein. It is a hybrid species belonging to the genus Verbascum, which includes several species of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. This plant is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, particularly in Armenia and Georgia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant, and bloom during the summer months.
